releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • fix parse for tags w/ double digit patch numbers by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/3
  • make group #3 non-capturing, since we never reference it. by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/2
  • No need to validate series when parsing binary version by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/4
  • Mention proper license by @aviau in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/5
  • Export regex patterns by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/6
  • Version without build by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/7
  • Convert to go mod and use juju/mgo/v2 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/8
  • Rename Series to Release to make the version Binary more generic by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/9
  • Support non-strict version parsing by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/10
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/11

New Contributors

  • @wallyworld made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/4
  • @aviau made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/5
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/6
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/7
  • @achilleasa made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/version/pull/10

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/version/commits/v2.0.0

releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • fixes LP 1580391 by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/25
  • Print the stack trace when formatting with %+v by @mkmik in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/28
  • Add forbidden error by @geoffreybauduin in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/30
  • misspell fix on functions.go by @hiveminded in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/31
  • Simplify slice definition by @spring1843 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/32
  • Update for lander. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/35
  • add timeout err by @gertcuykens in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/34
  • made getgopath more accurate by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/36
  • typo by @temoto in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/37
  • fix Err.Format by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/38
  • Fix typo by @spring1843 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/39
  • Start comments with the name of the element it describes by @spring1843 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/33
  • configurable source trim prefix, default $GOPATH/src by @temoto in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/43
  • docs: fix typos by @Jason-Cooke in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/44
  • Introduce QuotaLimitExceeded error by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/45
  • Define NotYetAvailable error type by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/48
  • Refresh deps and use go 1.17 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/49
  • [JUJU-710] Removes juju/testing from requires. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/51
  • [JUJU-753] Add Err.Unwrap to support standard error library (Go 1.13+) by @barrettj12 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/52
  • [JUJU-754] Updates SetLocation functionality to work with mod. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/53
  • [JUJU-790] Add GitHub Action to run go test by @barrettj12 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/55
  • [JUJU-759] Change error types to use new ConstError by @barrettj12 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/54
  • Fixes panics found in Juju for nil errors. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/56
  • Independent SetLocation and WithType for errors. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/57
  • [JUJU-1339] Adds a shush method to the library and IsType. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/59
  • Adds support for a new convenience function AsType and HasType. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/60

New Contributors

  • @mkmik made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/28
  • @geoffreybauduin made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/30
  • @hiveminded made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/31
  • @spring1843 made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/32
  • @gertcuykens made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/34
  • @ycliuhw made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/36
  • @temoto made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/37
  • @Jason-Cooke made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/44
  • @achilleasa made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/45
  • @tlm made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/51
  • @barrettj12 made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/52

Use env variable NETWORK{2,3,4} for different virsh nets

tags.name: v2.0.0
tags.body:
Merge pull request #65 from SimonRichardson/charm-dependencies

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/65

As the charm brings in dependency breaking changes (prefix for bundles are required), this ensures that all consumers of this library are fully exposed to the fact that the underlying charm and charmrepo changes are breaking changes and I’m forcing bundlechanges users to understand this.

The number of changes inside go mod and sum are a bit concerning, but all the tests pass, so I’m inclined to leave it as-is for now.

tags.name: v1.0.0
tags.body:
Merge pull request #64 from SimonRichardson/deterministic-master

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/64

The following ensure that the applications that we loop through are deterministic, so that when adding application units we skip correctly with in the loop.

This is fixing LP #1883645

Merge pull request #64 from SimonRichardson/deterministic-master

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Initial import of pubsub branch for review. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/1
  • Simplify the types to remove Topic and Unsubscriber. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/4
  • Error response changed in latest go versions. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/5
  • Fix the deadlock in the multiplexer by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/6
  • Add dependencies.tsv and update Makefile. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/7
  • Make creating a subscriber only log at trace level by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/8
  • Fix multiplexer unsubscribe while publish by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/9
  • Add a multiplexer for the simple hub. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/10
  • Publish wait by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/12
  • Metrics: Expose underlying queue status by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/13
  • [JUJU-332] Fix programmatic errors in production by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/14
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/15

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/1
  • @babbageclunk made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/8
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/12
  • @wallyworld made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/15

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/pubsub/commits/v2.0.0

What’s Changed

This is a patch release for fixing some build problems in the 3.3.1.0 release that rendered it unusable in some scenarios (see https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/issues/1026 for details).

  • Resolve build problems in 3.3.1.0 by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1026
  • Release 3.3.1.1 notes by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1027

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/3.3.1.0…3.3.1.1

What’s Changed

  • Remove paramiko upper-bound by @gboutry in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1005
  • Remove explicit passing of event_loop into tests by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1006
  • chore: remove the upper restrictions on the websockets dependency by @tonyandrewmeyer in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1007
  • Target ceiling version by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1008
  • Make it easier to run tests using make by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1012
  • Avoid installing signal handlers to the event loop by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1014
  • feat: remove app block until done by @yanksyoon in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1017
  • feat: remove app timeout by @yanksyoon in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1018
  • Forward port latest changes from 2.9 onto 3.x by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1022
  • Release 3.3.1.0 notes by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1024

New Contributors

  • @gboutry made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1005
  • @tonyandrewmeyer made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1007
  • @yanksyoon made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1017

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/3.3.0.0…3.3.1.0

What’s Changed

  • Drop use of walrus operator by @freyes in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/993
  • No controller model access needed for connection with a non-admin user by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1003
  • Password resolution in connector by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1002
  • Remove dependency to juju-cli for controller_name by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1009
  • Release 2.9.46.1 notes by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1023

New Contributors

  • @freyes made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/993

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Expose PruneTxns in order to allow external tools to use it by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/16
  • Add progress logging while pruning transactions by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/17
  • Retry errors that finish with ‘unexpected message’. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • Add export_test.go by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/19
  • Use mgo.Collection.Bulk to prune docs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/20
  • Add RunTransaction observer by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/21
  • Use disk-based pruning strategy by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/22
  • Make prune log output consistent by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/23
  • Cleanup txn.Stash as part of regular pruning by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • Cleanup all collections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/25
  • Don’t create transactions that have no operations. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/27
  • Abstract out “Completed Transaction” functionality by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/26
  • Properly test no-op does the right thing, as does real errors. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/28
  • Add a command-line utility to clean and purge txns. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • Add logging information about the pruning result. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/29
  • Turns out it isn’t safe to use aggregation in 2.4 at all. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/31
  • support using RemoveAll($in) instead of Bulk. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/32
  • Various cleanups by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/35
  • track what is actually removed by Oracle.RemoveTxns() by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/34
  • Expose a NewestTime for PruneOptions. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/36
  • Handle Bulk.Run() result being nil by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/37
  • When observing transactions include the run Duration. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/40
  • Change Clock back to being optional. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/41
  • Allow passing in a parameter to limit the number of transactions evaluated by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/42
  • Expose the batch size and number of batches. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/43
  • No need for uint64 and it makes default printing ugly by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/44
  • Use juju/clock package for the clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/45
  • Incremental prune by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/46
  • 2.4 prune options by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/47
  • Pass the transaction attempt by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • Revert “Merge pull request #48 from SimonRichardson/txn-attempt” by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/51
  • Add testing.SetFailIfTransaction. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/49
  • Retry i/o timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/52
  • Thread through the transaction by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/50
  • juju/txn with server side transactions by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/55
  • Add help text to explain why hooks do not run by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • Properly handle when RemoveAll returns an error. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/57
  • Use github.com/juju/mgo/v2 and convert to go mod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/58
  • Add extra txn backoff tuning parameters for sstxn by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/59
  • Make retry fuzz a percent and use durations instead of floats by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/60
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/61
  • Add support for no change log, used when upgrading to SSTXN. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • @jameinel made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • @cmars made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/txn/commits/v2.0.0

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • httptesting: fix for Go 1.6 by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/93
  • testing: remove deprecated AddSuiteCleanup function by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/94
  • add PatchExecHelper and CaptureOutput helpers by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/95
  • Fix PatchExecHelper.GetExecCommand on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/96
  • Handle the error return from utils.SetHome(). by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/97
  • testing: add TCPProxy.CloseConns by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/98
  • mgo: don’t panic while resetting admin password by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/99
  • Don’t drop and recreate the database between tests by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • testing: don’t panic during TearDownTest if SetUpTest failed by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/101
  • Added BSONEquals checker by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • Detect mongod version before starting test server by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/104
  • lp:1596045 handle CRLF in mongo version line by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/105
  • copy clock from juju/juju/testing by @jrwren in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/106
  • Update to use the latest loggo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/107
  • Retry mgo dial if unexpected message. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/109
  • Hook up mgo logging and reconnect properly. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/110
  • add NewProxiedSession by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/111
  • implement Clock.NewTimer by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/108
  • Bump mongo error output to 100 lines by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • Update testing.Clock to improve robustness by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/113
  • NewProxiedSession - ping to assign a socket to the returned session. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • checkers: ignore time zone in DeepEqual by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/115
  • MongoDB needs –key=value not –key value now by @dooferlad in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/116
  • Fixes for replicaset by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • Introduces a type which can be used to mock calls by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/118
  • tcpproxy: add pause and resume to the stream by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/119
  • Disable mgo logging/debugging by default by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/120
  • Mongo 3.4 uses a different string to indicate it is ready for connections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/121
  • Fix EchoQuotedArgsUnix/AssertEchoArgs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/122
  • Fix PatchExecutableAsEchoArgs on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/124
  • Prefer mongod 3.2 and improve mongod info caching by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • Default mongo storage backend to mmapv1 by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/126
  • Add MgoInstance.SSLEnabled method by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/125
  • Remove deprecated –sslOnNormalPorts arg to mongod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/127
  • Fix typo in mongo command by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/128
  • Stub check calls without order. by @anastasiamac in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • testing: default to mmapv1 only on x86(_64) by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/133
  • Don’t try to truncate the local replicaset oplog. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/135
  • Changes to support Mongo 3.6. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/136
  • Expose the version of Mongo that we are testing against. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/137
  • enable vendor as the highest priority import path by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • Add short and long timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/139
  • Use juju/clock by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/140
  • Add the location of mongod in bionic to the list of places we look. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/141
  • Enable Mongo with Replica Sets by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/142
  • If using Replicaset use wiredTiger. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/143
  • Add support for finding the juju-db snap when looking for mongod by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • Allow testing of DoRequest against status code by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145
  • Malformed errors by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/146
  • Fix address already in use detection. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/147
  • Move to go mod + fix juju-db snap usage by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/148
  • Fix issue with juju suites overwriting HOME by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/149
  • Sidestep HOME env var for juju-db snap testing by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/150
  • Add multi-checker by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/151
  • Add go style expressions for multichecker matching. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/152
  • Upgrade juju/utils package to v2 by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/153
  • Fix performance issue with using collstats. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/154
  • Only use mmapv1 args for mmap storage engine by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/155
  • Only use maxTransactionLockRequestTimeoutMillis for mongo 4 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/156
  • Update to use juju/mgo/v2 repo by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/158
  • Ensure that the namespaced collections in the logs db are removed during teardown. by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/160
  • Allow suites that depend on MgoSuite to disable cleanup. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/162
  • Update to use utils/v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/163
  • Upstream dep updates by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/164

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • wireformat/budget: export baseURL to help with testing by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/22

  • Fixes newlines in cmd responses. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/26
  • Decode error messages from omnibus. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/27
  • cmd: Minor changes to make ftests easier to write by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/28
  • Parse allocation limit properly in the allocate command. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/29
  • Use uitable right-alignment feature with numerics. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/30
  • Sorted allocations. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/32
  • plan/api: Export url to help ftests by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/31
  • api/terms: Export BaseURL to make testing easier by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/33
  • 20160418 juju deps by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/36
  • Update juju dependencies. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/34
  • Resolving model name in show-budget. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/35
  • cmd/listplans: Return a more appropriate type to help with testing by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/37
  • setplan: Fixed the output of set plan, argument order was reversed in error message by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/39
  • Allow specifying juju allocate –model-uuid, improve help. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/40
  • Rename service to application by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/43
  • Account for service to application changes in juju-core by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/44
  • Update dependencies to juju w/ service-to-application landed. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/47

releases.title: 2.10.0 Pebble custom notices, adjustments to relation-broken, and more
releases.body:
This release adds support for Pebble custom notices, including in the Harness testing framework, and removes the broken relation from the model’s relations list when in the relation-broken event. There’s also the usual collection of documentation improvements, bug fixes, and other minor improvements.

Pebble Notices

Pebble now includes a subsystem called Notices, each of which has a type and a key (currently the only type is “custom”). Custom notices allow the workload to wake up the charm when something interesting happens with the workload, for example, when a PostgreSQL backup process finishes, or some kind of alert occurs.

Workloads can run pebble notify to record an occurrence of a custom notice, providing a unique key and optional data, and Juju will trigger a PebbleCustomNotice event on the charm for it to take appropriate action.

Support for Pebble Notices is available from Juju 3.4.0 onwards. Read the docs about how to use custom notices from the workload container.

Relation-Broken

When a charm is handling a relation-broken event, the relation is on the verge of being removed. A common pattern in charms is to iterate through Model.relations (to generate a configuration file, for example), and the broken relation should not be included with the active relations. To simplify charm code, Model.relations now excludes the broken relation. The relation is still accessible via the event’s .relation attribute, and all Relation objects now have an .active attribute to distinguish between the broken relation (active == False) and other relations (active == True).

The plan is that this change will also appear when using the Juju hook tools directly in a future version of Juju.

This does not change accessing the relation data during relation-broken, and this does not change any behaviour in relation-departed.

Features

  • feat: support for Pebble Notices in #1100
  • feat: add Relation.active, exclude inactive relations from Model.relations in #1091
  • feat: when handling actions, print uncaught exceptions to stderr in #1087
  • feat: model error on testing module if invalid status set by charm by @yanksyoon in #1107
  • feat: add support for v2 fields in CharmMeta in #1106

Fixes

  • fix: add pebble log targets and checks to testing plan by @PietroPasotti in #1111
  • fix(charm): make collect-status a LifeCycleEvent to avoid logging it by @PietroPasotti in #1080

Documentation

  • docs: update README.md in light of changes to charmcraft init output by @tmihoc in #1089
  • docs: document limitations with pushing locked or bind-mount files in #1094
  • docs: add instructions on how to use a custom version of ops in a Charm in #1092

Tooling

  • build: migrate to pyproject.toml in #1068
  • ci: use a trusted publisher token for publishing to PyPI in #1061
  • fix(typing): update to latest version of Pyright and fix errors in #1105

Many thanks to @PietroPasotti, @yanksyoon, and @tmihoc for their contributions to this release!

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.9.0…2.10.0

releases.title: 2.9.0: Pebble log forwarding, unit testing actions, and more
releases.body:
This release makes it easy to write tests for your Charm actions, aligns testing secrets with upcoming Juju changes, and exposes the ability to use the new Pebble log forwarding functionality. There’s also the usual collection of documentation improvements, bug fixes, and other minor improvements.

Unit Testing Actions

Writing unit tests for actions with Harness is now as simple as:

def test_action(harness):
    out = harness.run_action("my-action-name", {"param1": value, "param2": value2})
    assert out.results == {"result1": "expected"}

Added in #1053

Secrets

In the original implementation of Juju secrets, the owner of a secret would automatically peek (get the latest revision) at secret contents - this also meant that using ‘refresh’ was not allowed (since there was no revision tracking). This behaviour causes difficulties in some situations, so is being changed in the next versions of Juju (back to 3.1.7), removing the automatic peek and allowing refresh.

In ops, we are switching to the new behaviour, and this applies regardless of the detected/set JujuVersion. This primarily applies to Harness, which was updated in #1067, but also to the ops documentation. The constraints outside of Harness are applied by Juju, so your charms will reflect the new behaviour when Juju updates.

Note that you can get the old behaviour by always using refresh=True if that’s what you prefer (to support both old and new Juju, you’ll need to wrap this so that in older Juju you retry when it complains that you can’t refresh).

We’ve also fixed the simulated access to app secrets for non-leaders in #1076.

Pebble Log Targets

Pebble 1.4 added the ability to configure log forwarding for services to a Loki server, and Pebble 1.6 extends this with the ability to add custom labels to the forwarded logs. This functionality is now exposed in ops via a new (optional) log-targets section in Pebble layers and plans. Added in #1074

Documentation Improvements

  • A fresh README that’s simpler and better aligns with the docs and other projects in the Juju universe in #1052 - many thanks to @tmihoc for this contribution!
  • Clarified how custom events are emitted in emit() in #1072
  • Fixed the Harness.get_filesystem_root example in the docs in #1065

Minor Improvements

  • Removed the executable bit from all the .py files by in #1059 - thanks @jameinel!
  • The test suite now passes under Python 3.12 in #1081

Fixes

  • The SQLite storage file is no longer group/other readable. We strongly recommend against storing any secret data in stored state (use secrets), but we are aware of cases of this in the wild. This change prevents other users in the containers from being able to access the saved state file. Existing storage files will be chmod’d to 0o600 when ops first opens them after upgrading to 2.9.0+. #1057
  • When parsing a timestamp returned from Pebble, there was a 1 in 2 million chance that ops would fail with a ValueError. Fixed in #1084
  • Container.push_path and Harness.list_files would fail if the files/folders involved belonged to a user or group ID that did not have a name (for example, had been removed). Fixed in #1082. Thanks to @nedbat for the report!

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.8.0…2.9.0

releases.title: 2.8.0: Unit.reboot, RelationMeta.optional, and type-checked tests
releases.body:
This release includes a few small improvements: a new function Unit.reboot() (for machine charms only), the “optional” attribute of relations in metadata.yaml is now available in the RelationMeta object, and if the Pebble socket is missing (for example, if the container has just rebooted) we provide a clearer exception:

  • feat: add Unit.reboot for machine charms in #1041
  • feat: add RelationMeta.optional in #1038
  • feat: provide a clearer exception when the Pebble socket is missing in #1049

We fixed a couple of small issues:

  • fix: push_path and pull_path include empty directories in #1024
  • fix: reset collected statuses in Harness.evaluate_status in #1048

We’ve also made a few small improvements to the documentation:

  • docs: note that status changes are immediate in #1029
  • docs: add note to ActionEvent.set_results about maximum size in #1047
  • docs: document more of the exceptions that may be raised in #1044
  • docs: make pebble.Client.remove_path and Container.remove_path docs consistent in #1031
  • docs: update the PyPI development status to production/stable in #1020

Finally, we wrapped up our work on #1007, so the test suite is now fully type checked, did a couple of other minor type hinting improvements, and broke out the ‘real’ Pebble tests into a separate file for more clarity (you can still just run tox -e pebble):

  • test: add type hints to test_testing in #1017
  • test: add type hints to test_model in #1015
  • test: add type hints to test_charm in #1022
  • test: add type hints to test_storage in #1023
  • test: add type hints to test_framework in #1025
  • test: add type hints to test_main in #1028
  • test: add type hints to pebble-related tests in #1030
  • test: separate the real pebble tests into a separate module in #1018
  • chore: remove as much ‘if typing.TYPE_CHECKING:’ as possible in #1034
  • feat: narrow the type for ‘app’ and ‘unit’ in relation events by in #1032

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.7.0…2.8.0

releases.title: v1.8.0: deadlock fix, port various items from snapd
releases.body:
This release includes a fix for the “Pebble is unresponsive” deadlock issue described in #314, in addition to cross-porting various features from snapd, most notably the overlord/state changes in #344. Full list of changes below:

What’s Changed

  • ci(snap): cope with concurrent builds by @cjdcordeiro in #341
  • tests(daemon): improve test coverage of notices API by @olivercalder in #346
  • chore(state): cross-port latest changes from snapd’s overlord/state by @dmitry-lyfar in #344
  • fix(cmdstate): use imperative language and uppercase for task summary by @medvied in #348
  • chore(deps): Bump critical dependencies. by @hpidcock in #353
  • daemon: make ucrednetGet() return *ucrednet by @thp-canonical in #357
  • fix(servstate): reduce scope of holding ServiceManager.planLock by @benhoyt in #355
  • fix(servstate): don’t hold both servicesLock and state lock at once by @benhoyt in #359

New Contributors

  • @medvied made their first contribution in #348

Full list of commits: https://github.com/canonical/pebble/compare/v1.7.0…v1.8.0

commits.author: Daniela Plascencia
commits.message:
fix: remove prefix from command and set a working-dir to /app (#76)

In the past, this image used to pass –prefix /app to the npm start command, which is used to force non-global commands to run in the specified folder. We are removing that prefix and instead setting up a working-dir to keep consisdenty with upstream.

commits.author: Daniela Plascencia
commits.message:
chore: update rockcraft project, add sanity test, and tox.ini file (#74)

  • chore: update rockcraft project, add sanity test, and tox.ini file

This commit updates the rockcraft project to match the new requirements from the latest rockcraft version. It also refactors the security requirement to match the latest format in other rock repositories. Bash is now removed from the image as it is not required and not recommended in production environments, and the build dependency on apt is also removed as it was not used at all. Adding sanity tests in this rock’s repository and its corresponding tox file. Finally, this commit bumps the version of the centraldashboard and uses node 14 to keep consistency with upstream.

Fixes #71

commits.author: Daniela Plascencia
commits.message:
ci: add reusable CI for build, publish, test and scans (#73)

Refactor the CI and re-use the workflows in charmed-kubeflow-workflows repository. This commit adds workflows for: * build and publish workflow dispatch * build, scan, test, and publish on push and PR

Fixes #70

commits.author: Orfeas Kourkakis
commits.message:
feat: Trust kubeflow-volumes (#827)

Trust kubeflow-volumes after it was rewritten in canonical/kubeflow-volumes-operator#125.

  • Parametrize tests/integration test_bundle_deployment.py in order to be able to run for 1.7, 1.8 and latest.
  • ci: Update deploy-eks.yaml tox command Closes #800

commits.author: i-chvets
commits.message:
Merge pull request #1 from canonical/kf-4450-feat-metacontroller-rock

Description

metacontroller container image should be converted to ROCK. This PR contains initial ROCK implementation based on best practices.

Summary of changes:

  • Initial ROCK based on the same version of source code as upstream container.

Scan results:

ROCK image metacontroller:2.0.4_22.04_1 CRITICAL: 0 HIGH: 14 MED: 6 LOW: 0

As compared to upstream image metacontroller:2.0.4 CRITICAL: 3 HIGH: 41 MED: 11 LOW: 0

Testing

Manual testing was performed. See the log below.

Manual test log

  • update according to canonical/bundle-kubeflow#747
  • rename base to ubuntu@20.04 as per new rockcraft syntax
  • use 1.20/stable snap for Go
  • refactor tox.ini according to canonical/oidc-authservice-rock#14 and canonical/bundle-kubeflow#763

tags.body: build: bump version 0.3.5->0.3.6 (#53)

Gracefully handle empty remote app name (#35)

  • Gracefully handle empty remote app name

It shouldn’t ever happen but it seems that the remote app name can be set to blank during a relation-broken hook in some strange edge case which leads to a ModelError during SDI.__init__(). This handles that case more gracefully.

Fixes #34

releases.title: MicroK8s v1.29 released!
releases.body:
Featured in this release

“Quality of life” improvements

A lot of effort has gone into the datastore, DQlite. In this release we introduced the following improvements:

  • DQlite node role reassignment in case of failure domain availability changes
  • Optional admission control to ensure performance
  • Handling the out-of-disk-space cases
  • Performance improvements related to static linking of DQlite and SQL query preparation

New addons by our partners and community members

  • Falco: the cloud-native security tool that employs custom rules on kernel events to provide real-time alerts
  • CloudNative PG Operator: Leveraging cloud native Postgres for Kubernetes adds speed, efficiency and protection for your infrastructure modernization
  • ngrok: Ingress Controller instantly adds connectivity, load balancing, authentication, and observability to your services

Detail list of updates since last release

Kubernetes core services

  • Kubernetes 1.29

    Usability Improvements

  • Improved messaging in joining nodes

  • Fix the default IP shown in microk8s add-node output when using FRR (thanks @nihr23)

  • Improve connectivity check in installers, thank you @smithyuk

  • Handle out of low disk capacity on dqlite nodes

  • Admission control to protect from dqlite performance degradation

  • Failure domain control plain datastore rebalance

  • Memory argument warning in installer, thank you @eddiesimeon

    Addon updates

  • New addon: nvidia, allows for enabling the gpu and network operators

  • New addon: Falco v3.7.1, thank you @jasonumiker

  • New addon: CloudNativePG, thank you @sxd

  • New addon: ngrok, thank you @russorat

  • Added default-class option to hostpath-storage, thank you @overtfuture

  • Upgraded sosivio to v1.7.1, thank you @DanArlowski

  • Upgrade linkerd to v2.14.3, thank you @balchua

  • Upgraded KWasm operator to version v0.3.0, thank you @0xE282B0

  • Upgrade keda to v2.12.0, thank you @balchua

  • Upgraded hostpath-storage to v1.5.0

  • Upgraded MICROCKS to v1.8.0, thank you @yada

  • hostpath-storage option not to be set as the default storage class, courtesy of @overtfuture

  • Removed ondat addon from the community repository

releases.title: installer-v2.3.4
releases.body: microk8s version: 1.28 kubectl version: 1.28.3 multipass version: 1.12.2 installer version: 2.3.4

releases.title: MicroK8s v1.28 released!
releases.body:
Featured in this release

Dual stack support and CIDR configuration made easy

In the past, community members provided instructions on how to configure dual-stack in MicroK8s clusters. From this release onwards, dual-stack along with the respective CIDR configuration can be easily setup with launch configurations even at install time.

You can read more on dual stack over at: - https://microk8s.io/docs/explain-dual-stack - https://microk8s.io/docs/how-to-dual-stack

Improve security and CIS compliance

Full CIS compliance can be achieved with a single call: microk8s enable cis-hardening. For auditors and those interested in what each CIS recommendation is about we have assembled a detailed list of each recommendation and how we comply with it. Some of the CIS hardening suggestions have been adopted as default setup options in MicroK8s, for example the authentication of users is now done via x509 certificates instead of tokens.

For the work on this feature you can read: - https://microk8s.io/docs/cis-compliance - https://microk8s.io/docs/how-to-cis-harden

Ceph and MicroK8s

Try this microk8s enable rook-ceph to get the Rook Ceph operator on your cluster. We found that pairing MicroCeph, the low ops Ceph distribution, with MicroK8s produces a great setup in terms of feature richenss, stability and effectiveness. In our docs we have a guide showing how to testdirve this combination on a single node cluster.

Read more at: - https://microk8s.io/docs/how-to-ceph - https://canonical-microceph.readthedocs-hosted.com/en/latest/ - https://rook.io/

New partner joining our addons ecosystem

Two addons joined our ecosystems:

  • KubeArmor is a cloud-native runtime security enforcement system that restricts the behavior (such as process execution, file access, and networking operations) of pods, containers, and nodes at the system level.

  • MICROCKS is a CNCF project designed to simplify and streamline API mocking and testing, with support for many different types of API and integrations for GitHub, Gitlab, Jenkins and more.

Detail list of updates since last release

Kubernetes core services

  • Kubernetes v1.28

  • Calico CNI updated to v3.25.1

    Usability Improvements

  • microk8s status will return an error code in case the cluster is not yet ready.

  • microk8s join no longer fails if nodes cannot resolve each others hostnames. This limitation has been lifted by updating the default arguments of kube-apiserver.

  • fixes iptables rule with custom CIDR, thanks @Dunge

  • Certificate based authentication replaces token auth

  • kubelet certificate authority set to the cluster CA by default

  • RBAC rules for kubelet webhook auth-mode loaded by default

  • EventRateLimit is enabled by default

  • Kubelet now does not serialize image pulls by default, which should result in faster image pulls (thanks @ghboutry)

  • Attempt to increase inotify and async IO limits if found too low

    Addon updates

  • New addon: kubearmor, thanks to @nyrahul and @webdevgopi

  • New addon: microcks, thank you @yada

  • Update ArgoCD to v2.7.2 and add support for ARM64, thank you @alirezaghey

  • Coredns updated to v1.10.1

  • cilium updated to 1.13.4 now supporting multi-node clusters

  • gopapdle updated to v4.2.9, added support for ARM64, renamed to goppadle from goppadle-lite, thank you @Gayathri-Bluemeric

  • Metrics server updated to v0.6.3

  • Ingress updated to v1.8.0

  • linkerd updated to v2.13.5, thank you @balchua

  • keda updated to v2.11.1, thank you @balchua

  • kata addon expects to find a runtime and does not use the kata-runtime snap anymore

  • trivy addon updated tov 0.15.1

  • Metallb updated to v0.13.10, thank you @jadams

  • Istio updated to v1.18.2, thank you @aalonsolopez

commits.author: Benjamin Schimke
commits.message:
Add machinery to make errors human-readable (#131)

We face four different kinds of errors in the k8s-snap. This commit adds machinery to handle all of them:

On the server-side there are:

  1. microcluster errors: errors that directly come from microcluster. They are untyped and we need to rely on the error string to handle them.

  2. server-side errors: error that happen in our system and that we can formally define.

The errors are not preserved on the client. Microcluster simply sends the error message and creates a new error on the client. This means we cannot rely on error types by default. But we can define custom errors in api/v1/errors.go that support a direct string comparison by implementing the Error and Is interfaces.

For server-side errors we can simply use the exposed error types and the string comparison will always work. The error is basically just serialized on the server and deserialized on the client.

For the microcluster errors we need to be careful on library upgrades. The error messages are not recognized anymore, if microcluster changes the error messages. We can avoid this by adding strict integration tests that validate the explicit CLI output.

On the client-side there are:

  1. generic client-side errors: errors that pop up on the client/CLI, e.g. cannot connect to k8sd and apply for all commands.

  2. custom client-side errors: errors that are unique for a specific command, e.g. ErrAlreadyBootstrapped.

This commit generically resolve those error by defining an error wrapper (cmd/k8s/errors/wrapper.go) that is injected at the root k8s CLI command and tries to resolve any error to a human-readable message. Generic errors translations are defined in the wrapper module, custom error messages can be defined in the command (see e.g. k8s_bootstrap.go)

Also, puts each CLI command into a function that expects a k8s client. Provides a mock implementation of the client so that unit tests for the CLI can be implemented.

commits.author: Mia Altieri
commits.message:
disable all startup services (#37)

It doesn’t make sense for any of the daemons in charmed-mongodb snap to start up automatically in the snap. They require specific configurations and an up and a running mongos instance. We can keep them enabled, but they will show an error state:

ubuntu@ip-172-31-37-213:~$ sudo snap logs charmed-mongodb.pbm-agent
2023-09-16T14:25:39Z systemd[1]: Started Service for snap application charmed-mongodb.pbm-agent.
2023-09-16T14:25:39Z charmed-mongodb.pbm-agent[4119638]: 2023/09/16 14:25:39 Error: Parse command line parameters: required flag --mongodb-uri not provided
2023-09-16T14:25:39Z systemd[1]: snap.charmed-mongodb.pbm-agent.service: Deactivated successfully.

Add mysqlrouter exporter snap daemon and upgrade to 8.0.35 (#41)

  • Upgrade to 8.0.35 and add snap daemon for mysqlrouter exporter

  • Avoid assumption that snap daemons inherit env vars

  • Relay env vars into the exec command when running as snap daemon

  • Always skip tls cert verification for router exporter in snaps

  • Run apt-get clean before checking version mismatch in CI

  • Add mysqlrouter-exporter as exception to the smoke test

  • Run apt-cache policy temp lxc container for version mismatch check

  • Run lxd init in version mismatch check

  • Use sg to run lxc commands

  • Use sudo to run apt-get update in temp lxd container

  • Add sleep to ensure the temp lxd container is launched

  • Remove experimental lxc-wait command

  • Add tmate session

  • Change tmate session to run on pull request

  • Remove tmate session and run apt-get update before getting apt version

  • Clean up passing opts to commands + clean up comments

  • Use echo for exporter options in daemon scripts

  • Add slot for mysqlrouter logs

  • Add mysqlrouter_password snap command

  • Unify logs related slots into one slot

  • Run mysqlrouter-passwd as a script that de-escalates privileges to snap_daemon

  • Run mysqlrouter-passwd with sudo while running smoke tests

  • Add a way to pass extra config options to mysqlrouter daemon script

  • Upgrade mysqlsh to 8.0.35 and minor CI command improvement

releases.title: v0.9.0
releases.body:
Highlights: this release introduces verification of GPG signatures for the Ubuntu archives’ InRelease files. This is also associated with an incoming change of format for the chisel-releases - this release now supports both chisel-v1 and v1 formats, noting that the former will soon be removed, in favour of v1.

What’s Changed

  • feat: integrity checks for Ubuntu Release files by @letFunny and @rebornplusplus in #106
  • feat: add support for chisel release format “v1” by @letFunny and @rebornplusplus in #115

Other minor changes

  • fix starlark link by @shyim in #110
  • make Spread tests run for multiple chisel-releases by @cjdcordeiro in #114

New Contributors

  • @shyim made their first contribution in #110

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v0.8.1…v0.9.0

releases.title: v0.8.1
releases.body:
Highlights: apart from testing and documentation improvements, this release uses a more appropriate HTTP client for fetching larger files. It also makes the expected chisel-releases schema more permissive, ignoring unknown fileds instead of raising an error.

What’s Changed

  • fix: use proper HTTP clients to fetch files by @rebornplusplus in #66
  • bugfix: ignore extra fields in yaml by @letFunny in #107

Other minor changes

  • chore: promote “riscv64” snap to candidate on release by @rebornplusplus in #95
  • slicer/test: Define all release archives by @woky in #81
  • testutil/pkgdata: Handle empty names in MakeDeb() by @woky in #85
  • testutil/pkgdata: Add MakeTestDeb() by @woky in #87
  • fsutil: Explicit parent directory creation by @woky in #76
  • slicer/test: Set archive options from release by @woky in #82
  • Switch from kinetic to focal in spread tests by @woky in #97
  • CI: Add CLA check, Linting and security scanning by @rebornplusplus in #31
  • testutil/pkgdata: Add TarEntry shorthand constructors by @woky in #86
  • Support OpenPGP keyrings in release by @woky in #100
  • docs: add snap and CI badges to README by @cjdcordeiro in #104

New Contributors

  • @letFunny made their first contribution in #107

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v0.8.0…v0.8.1

releases.title: v0.8.0
releases.body:
We’re proud to announce the first versioned release of Chisel!

Work has been ongoing for the last few months, and this release represents the first of many upcoming releases.

Chisel is a software tool for carving and cutting Debian packages!

It is built on the idea of package slices - minimal, complimentary and loosely coupled sets of files, based on the packages metadata and content. Slices are basically subsets of the Debian packages, with their own content and set of dependencies to other internal and external slices.

To install the latest version of Chisel, run the following command:

go install github.com/canonical/chisel/cmd/chisel@v0.8.0

Chisel is invoked using chisel . To get more information:

To see a help summary, type chisel -h. To see a short description of all commands, type chisel help --all. To see details for one command, type chisel help <command> or chisel <command> -h.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/commits/v0.8.0

commits.author: Mariyan Dimitrov
commits.message:
fix(starter): Rename JSON metadata files (#4)

The JSON metadata files require an .properties.json extension, so this commit renames the .json files to .properties.json.

In addition, I’ve moved the icons from a dedicated icons/ folder in the workflow-templates/ folder, as they need to be present here according to the doc at https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/creating-starter-workflows-for-your-organization

releases.title: v0.8.1
releases.body:
Fixed

  • Migration error where discourse is in-line with the default branch but the base content tag is behind. This no longer attempts migration and now also moves the tag to the latest commit on the default branch.

releases.title: v0.8.0
releases.body:
Added

  • Support for migrating the navigation table to the contents index
  • Checks that external references on the contents index return a 2XX response to HEAD requests

Fixed

  • Whitespace buildup between generated and input content

releases.title: v0.7.0
releases.body:
Added

  • Support for defining a contents index in the index.md file.
  • Support for hidden items on the contentx index.
  • Support for external items on the contents index
  • Automatically moving the discourse-gatekeeper/content tag when the documentation is up to date with discourse

Fixed

  • Navigation table not getting removed if the contents was hidden using the [details=...]...[/details] tag.
  • No longer use empty values from INPUT_COMMIT_SHA instead of reading the event/ environment
  • Removing leading and trailing whitespace in base content for comparison
  • Correct failing pre-flight checks due to shallowly checked out repos

commits.author: Andrea Ieri
commits.message:
Use the auto-generated token.

Instead of manually managing personal access tokens as repo secrets, use the auto-generated one. See https://docs.github.com/en/actions/security-guides/automatic-token-authentication

commits.author: Andrea Ieri
commits.message:
Determine the latest compatible version via RSS feeds.

The tempest and tempest plugin metadata files in the releases[0] repository are not updated continuously and therefore do not reflect the actual latest compatible version for a given OpenStack release (see also the Tempest nad Plugins compatible version policy[1]). This commit switches to using the individual projects’ RSS feeds as source of truth as to which version should be picked; specifically, the “{release}-last” tag if available, and the latest version tag otherwise.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases.git [1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

Closes: #79
